meanings.definition: A man who is the main presenter of a television or radio news program.
meanings.sent1: The anchorman reported the breaking news to the viewers.
meanings.sent2: The anchorman delivered the weather forecast with confidence.
meanings.sent3: The anchorman's tie matched the color of the newsroom walls.
meanings.sent4: The anchorman steered the news broadcast like a captain navigating a ship.
meanings.sent5: The anchorman's voice boomed through the studio, commanding attention.
meanings.sent6: In the studio, the anchorman sat at the news desk, ready to go live.
meanings.sent7: During the broadcast, the anchorman maintained a professional demeanor.
meanings.sent8: Viewers trusted the anchorman to provide accurate information.
meanings.sent9: The anchorman's smile brightened up the screen as he reported the story.
meanings.sent10: As the anchorman spoke, his words carried authority and reassurance.

meanings.definition: A man who is in charge of a group or organization and who is responsible for making sure that things are done correctly.
meanings.sent1: The anchorman of the project team ensured all tasks were completed on time.
meanings.sent2: As the anchorman of the committee, he led the members effectively.
meanings.sent3: The anchorman of the office party made sure everyone had a good time.
meanings.sent4: In the company, he was the anchorman who kept operations running smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The anchorman of the event coordinated all the details flawlessly.
meanings.sent6: During the meeting, the anchorman guided the discussion to reach a decision.
meanings.sent7: The anchorman's attention to detail prevented any mistakes from happening.
meanings.sent8: Colleagues respected the anchorman for his leadership and dedication.
meanings.sent9: The anchorman's organizational skills were crucial for the project's success.
meanings.sent10: As the anchorman, he ensured that every team member's contribution was valued.
